safire.utils.transformers module¶

transformers.py is a library that contains various non-NNET SAFIRE transformer components, mainly used for miscellaneous preprocessing (scaling, normalization, sigmoid nonlinearity, etc.).

class safire.utils.transformers.CappedNormalizationTransform(corpus, max_target=0.9999)[source]¶

Bases: safire.utils.transformers.NormalizationTransform

Given a corpus, normalizes each item to a sum such that the largest feature value in the corpus is just under 1.0.

class safire.utils.transformers.GeneralFunctionTransform(fn, multiplicative_coef=1.0, additive_coef=0.0, outer_multiplicative_coef=0.99975, outer_additive_coef=0.0)[source]¶

Bases: gensim.interfaces.TransformationABC

Transforms each value by the function given at initialization.

class safire.utils.transformers.GlobalUnitScalingTransform(corpus, cutoff=None)[source]¶

Bases: gensim.interfaces.TransformationABC

Scales vectors in the corpus so that the maximum element in the corpus is 1. This is to retain proportions between items in an unnormalized setting.

class safire.utils.transformers.LeCunnVarianceScalingTransform(corpus, sample=1000, chunksize=1000)[source]¶

Bases: gensim.interfaces.TransformationABC

Transforms features so that they all have the same “variance” defined by LeCunn, 1998: Efficient BackProp, 4.3, Eq. 13.

class safire.utils.transformers.NormalizationTransform(C=1.0)[source]¶

Bases: gensim.interfaces.TransformationABC

Given a corpus, will simply normalize all BOW inputs to sum to 1.

class safire.utils.transformers.SigmoidTransform(M=2.0, K=0.5, C=1.0)[source]¶

Bases: gensim.interfaces.TransformationABC

Transforms vectors through a squishing function:

f(x) = M / (1 + e^(-Kx)) - C

The defaults are M = 2.0, K = 0.5 and C = 1.0. MAKE SURE THAT f(0) = 0 !!!!

class safire.utils.transformers.MaxUnitScalingTransform[source]¶

Bases: gensim.interfaces.TransformationABC

Scales the vector so that its maximum element is 1.
